system.description: Almost as shady as the Assassin, a Thief is a bit more socially oriented and has a much greater care for her own life. Thieves are the flip side of the Samurai and tend to follow laws and tell the truth only if it serves their purpose. Always trying to make a profit, thieves are the businessmen of the world and will cheat you without blinking an eyelash, that is their job. If you are playing a thief, lie and make up stories, be ever watchful for a chance to search or loot and look for the profit angle, never doing anything for free.

overview.base: You crawl at half speed and can Move at half speed speed while hidden. Additionally, movement effects only require a DC 10 SNK feat save to keep from breaking your hiding.
overview.proficient: You crawl at full speed and can Move at full speed while hidden.

overview.base: Attacks you make from hiding are boosted. In addition, whenever you Interact or Unglue as a single action you may make trigger a Basic Attack or a second Interact as a free reaction as well.
overview.proficient: You may also trigger single action Thief abilities as free reactions in this way.

overview.base: Anything held in the targeted arm is knocked out of their hand. This triggers Catch Item.
You catch the item. If multiple creatures are all trying to catch the same item, they all roll [[/roll 1d20 + @p]]. The creature with the highest roll catches the item.

system.trigger: An item within range is falling or flying by.

overview.base: You are an expert courtier and peacekeeper. You also resist truth detecting effects and may give whichever response you like to them.
You are an expert locksmith.
